supy.observer.bumper module

supy.observer.bumper.safe_cached_time_to_num(time_str, time_conversion_cache)

Convert time string to numeric with caching for better performance.

supy.observer.bumper.safe_date2num(dt_obj: Any) → float | None

Safely convert datetime to numeric value for plotting. Handles the case where date2num returns a numpy array instead of a float.

supy.observer.bumper.safe_extract_time_strings(altaz_obj, attr_name='obstime')

Directly extract time values from possibly non-iterable TimeAttribute. Optimized version with caching for better performance.

supy.observer.bumper.safe_extract_times(altaz_obj, attr_name='obstime')

Directly extract time values for comparison.

supy.observer.bumper.safe_get(data_dict: Dict[str, Any], key: str, default: Any | None = None) → Any

Safely get a value from a dictionary with a default fallback.

supy.observer.bumper.safe_get_alt_value(altaz_obj)

Extract altitude value from AltAz object safely.

supy.observer.bumper.safe_get_attribute(obj, attr_path)

Extract a nested attribute safely. attr_path is a list like [‘alt’, ‘value’] for obj.alt.value

supy.observer.bumper.safe_get_datetime(time_obj) → datetime | None

Safely extract datetime from a Time object.

supy.observer.bumper.safe_get_separation_value(sep_obj)

Extract separation value safely.

supy.observer.bumper.safe_isoformat(time_obj)

Safely extract ISO format from a Time or TimeAttribute object.

supy.observer.bumper.safe_to_list(value) → List[float]

Convert a value to a list of floats safely.

supy.observer.mainobserver module

class supy.observer.mainobserver.mainObserver(OBSERVER_LONGITUDE: str | float | int = -70.7804, OBSERVER_LATITUDE: str | float | int = -30.4704, OBSERVER_ELEVATION: str | float | int = 1580, OBSERVER_TIMEZONE: str = 'America/Santiago', OBSERVER_NAME: str = 'Hyeonho Choi', OBSERVER_OBSERVATORY: str = '7DT')

Bases: object

Class for observing astronomical objects and events from a specific location on Earth.

Parameters:

  • OBSERVER_LATITUDE (1.) – The latitude of the observer’s location in degrees.

  • OBSERVER_LONGITUDE (2.) – The longitude of the observer’s location in degrees.

  • OBSERVER_ELEVATION (3.) – The elevation of the observer’s location in meters.

  • OBSERVER_TIMEZONE (4.) – The timezone of the observer’s location, in the format ‘Area/Location’.

  • OBSERVER_NAME (5.) – The name of the observer.

  • OBSERVER_OBSERVATORY (6.) – The name of the observatory.

  • **kwargs (optional) – Additional keyword arguments to pass to the Observer object.

1. get_obsinfo() -> dict

Returns a dictionary containing the observer’s information.

2. localtime(utctime: datetime = None) -> datetime

Converts the provided UTC time to the observer’s local time.

4. now() -> astropy.time.Time

Returns the current UTC time.

5. is_night(time: datetime or Time = None) -> bool

Returns True if it is night at the observer’s location at the provided UTC time.

6. tonight(time: datetime or Time = None, horizon: float = -18) -> tuple

Calculates the start and end times of tonight at the observer’s location, starting from the provided UTC time.

7. sun_radec(time: datetime or Time = None) -> astropy.coordinates.SkyCoord

Calculates the RA and Dec of the Sun at the provided UTC time.

8. sun_altaz(time: datetime or Time = None) -> astropy.coordinates.AltAz

Calculates the altitude and azimuth of the Sun at the observer’s location at the provided UTC time.

9. sun_risetime(time: datetime or Time = None, mode: str = 'nearest', horizon: float = -18) -> astropy.time.Time

Calculates the next rise time of the Sun at the observer’s location, starting from the provided UTC time.

10. sun_settime(time: datetime or Time = None, mode: str = 'nearest', horizon: float = -18) -> astropy.time.Time

Calculates the next set time of the Sun at the observer’s location, starting from the provided UTC time.

11. moon_radec(time: datetime or Time = None) -> astropy.coordinates.SkyCoord

Calculates the RA and Dec of the Moon at the provided UTC time.

12. moon_altaz(time: datetime or Time = None) -> astropy.coordinates.AltAz

Calculates the altitude and azimuth of the Moon at the observer’s location at the provided UTC time.

13. moon_risetime(time: datetime or Time = None, mode: str = 'nearest', horizon: float = -18) -> astropy.time.Time

Calculates the next rise time of the Moon at the observer’s location, starting from the provided UTC time.

14. moon_settime(time: datetime or Time = None, mode: str = 'nearest', horizon: float = -18) -> astropy.time.Time

Calculates the next set time of the Moon at the observer’s location, starting from the

get_status()

Returns observation information.

Returns:

1. obsinfo – A dictionary containing the following keys and values: - update_time: The UTC time at which the observation information was last updated, in ISO format. - name_observatory: The name of the observatory. - name_observer: The name of the observer. - latitude: The latitude of the observatory in degrees. - longitude: The longitude of the observatory in degrees. - elevation: The elevation of the observatory in meters. - timezone: The timezone of the observatory in hours relative to UTC. - observer: The astropy.coordinates.EarthLocation object representing the observer’s location.

Return type:

dict

is_night(utctimes: datetime | Time | ndarray | None = None)

Check if it is night at a given UTC time and location.

Parameters:

time (1.) – The UTC time at which to check if it is night. If not provided, the current time is used.

Returns:

1. is_night – True if it is night at the given time and location, False otherwise.

Return type:

bool

localtime(utctimes: datetime | ndarray | None = None)

Returns the datetime object representing the corresponding local time in the timezone specified by the object’s _timezone attribute.

Parameters:

utctime (1.) – The datetime object representing the time to convert to local time. If not provided, the current UTC time will be used.

Returns:

1. localtime – The datetime object representing the corresponding local time in the timezone specified by the object’s _timezone attribute.

Return type:

datetime

moon_altaz(utctimes: datetime | Time | array | None = None)

Calculates the altitude and azimuth of the Moon at the given time and location.

Parameters:

time (1.) – The UTC time at which to calculate the altitude and azimuth of the Moon. If not provided, the current time is used.

Returns:

1. moon_altaz – The altitude and azimuth of the Moon at the given time and location, as an AltAz object.

Return type:

astropy.coordinates.AltAz

moon_phase(utctimes: datetime | Time | array | None = None)

Calculates the phase of the Moon at the given time and location.

Parameters:

time (1.) – The UTC time at which to calculate the phase of the Moon. If not provided, the current time is used.

Returns:

1. k – Fraction of moon illuminated

Return type:

float

moon_radec(utctimes: datetime | Time | ndarray | None = None)

Calculates the RA and Dec of the Moon at the given time and location.

Parameters:

time (1.) – The UTC time at which to calculate the RA and Dec of the Moon. If not provided, the current time is used.

Returns:

1. moon_radec – The RA and Dec of the Moon at the given time, as a SkyCoord object.

Return type:

astropy.coordinates.SkyCoord

moon_risetime(utctimes: datetime | Time | array | None = None, mode='nearest', horizon=-18)

Calculates the next rise time of the Moon at the given time and location.

Parameters:

  • time (1.) – The UTC time at which to calculate the next rise time of the Moon. If not provided, the current time is used.

  • mode (2.) – The method to use for calculating the rise time of the Moon. Can be either ‘nearest’ (default), ‘next’, or ‘previous’.

  • horizon (3.) – The horizon angle to use when calculating the rise time of the Moon. Default is -18 degrees.

Returns:

1. moon_rise_time – The next rise time of the Moon at the given time and location, as a Time object.

Return type:

astropy.time.Time

moon_settime(utctimes: datetime | Time | array | None = None, mode='nearest', horizon=-18)

Calculates the next set time of the Moon at the given time and location.

Parameters:

  • time (1.) – The UTC time at which to calculate the next set time of the Moon. If not provided, the current time is used.

  • mode (2.) – The method to use for calculating the set time of the Moon. Can be either ‘nearest’ (default), ‘next’, or ‘previous’.

  • horizon (3.) – The horizon angle to use when calculating the set time of the Moon. Default is -18 degrees.

Returns:

1. moon_set_time – The next set time of the Moon at the given time and location, as a Time object.

Return type:

astropy.time.Time

1. time – The current UTC time.

risetime(ra: float | str | list, dec: float | str | list, utctime: datetime | Time | None = None, mode: str = 'next', horizon: float = 30)
Parameters:

  • radec (SkyCoord = Target(RADec) coordinates to calculate hourangle)

  • utctime (datetime.datetime or Time = Time(default = Now))

  • mode ({‘next’, ‘previous’, ‘nearest’}(default = next))

  • horizon (float = horizon angle in degree(default = -18))

Returns:

risetime

Return type:

Time = Target risetime

  • utctime (datetime.datetime or Time = Time(default = Now))

  • mode ({‘next’, ‘previous’, ‘nearest’}(default = nearest))

  • horizon (float = horizon angle in degree(default = -18))

Returns:

settime

Time = Target settime

Calculates the next rise time of the Sun at the given time and location.

  • mode (2.) – The method to use for calculating the rise time of the Sun. Can be either ‘nearest’ (default), ‘next’, or ‘previous’.

  • horizon (3.) – The horizon angle to use when calculating the rise time of the Sun. Default is -18 degrees.

tonight(time: datetime | Time | ndarray | None = None, horizon=-18)

Get the start and end times of tonight at a given UTC time and location.

Parameters:

  • time (1.) – The UTC time at which to start the calculation of the start and end of tonight. If not provided, the current time is used.

  • horizon (2.) – The horizon angle to use when calculating the start and end of tonight. Default is -18 degrees.

Returns:

1. tonight – A tuple of two astropy.time.Time objects representing the start and end times of tonight at the given time and location.

Return type:

tuple

supy.observer.staralt module

class supy.observer.staralt.Staralt(observer: mainObserver | None = None, utctime: datetime | Time | None = None)

Bases: object

Class to handle star altitude plots.

property data_dict: staraltParams
property is_observable: bool
property min_max_obstime
next_observable_night(search_days: int = 7)
property objname: str
property observer: mainObserver

Get the observer object.

plot_staralt(data: Dict[str, Any] | None = None, show_current_time: bool = True) → None

Plot the altitude data from the dictionary returned by set_target().

Parameters:

  • data (dict, optional) – The dictionary containing data required for plotting.

  • show_current_time (bool, optional) – Whether to show the current time marker on the plot.

set_target(ra: float | str, dec: float | str, objname: str | None = None, utctime: datetime | Time | None = None, time_shift: int | None = None, target_minalt: float = 30, target_minmoonsep: float = 30) → Dict[str, Any]

Generate the data needed for the altitude plot.

Parameters:

  • ra (float or str) – Right Ascension of the target in degrees (float) or in hms format (str).

  • dec (float or str) – Declination of the target in degrees (float) or in dms format (str).

  • time_shift (int)

  • objname (str, optional) – Name of the target object.

  • utctime (datetime or Time, optional) – The reference time. If None, current time is used.

  • target_minalt (float, optional) – The minimum allowable altitude for observation (in degrees).

  • target_minmoonsep (float, optional) – The minimum allowable moon separation (in degrees).

Returns:

A dictionary containing all data required for plotting.

Return type:

dict

property target_altaz: AltAz
property target_coord: SkyCoord
property utctime: Time

supy.observer.visibility_plotter module

class supy.observer.visibility_plotter.VisibilityPlotter(logger=None)

Bases: object

Handle visibility plot generation and Slack uploading for GCN notices.

This class creates visibility plots using staralt.py and handles temporary file management for uploading to Slack. It provides specialized visibility analysis for GRB observations from Chile.

create_visibility_plot(ra, dec, grb_name=None, test_mode=False, minalt=30, minmoonsep=30, savefig=True)

Create a visibility plot for given coordinates.

Parameters:

  • ra – Right Ascension in degrees

  • dec – Declination in degrees

  • grb_name – Name of the GRB for plot title

  • test_mode – If True, save plot to test_plots directory instead of temp file

  • minalt – Minimum altitude for target in degrees

  • minmoonsep – Minimum moon separation for target in degrees

Returns:

(path_to_plot_file, visibility_info) or (None, visibility_info) if not observable

Return type:

tuple

format_visibility_message(visibility_info: Dict[str, Any]) → str

Format visibility information into a structured message for Slack.
